content.question: The series <math alttext="x plus, x cubed, plus the fraction with numerator x raised to the fifth power, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x to the seventh power, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus dot dot dot, plus the fraction with numerator x raised to the 2 n plus 1 power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is the Maclaurin series for what function?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sine of negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x times, e raised to the x squared power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x times, e raised to the x squared power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.14: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor or Maclaurin Series for a Function

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
